poem:
Title: "Ode to the Ascent"

In youthful valor, songs take flight,
Against nature's canvas, broad and bright,
The Symphony of Strauss sublime,
Echoes of the Alpine chime.
Striving artists, purpose met,
In music's steep and lofty fret.
Howard's Ascent, a new refrain,
An echo of the mountaineer's gain,
A peak and promise both assent,
In the harmonious song of ascent.
prompt: You are the poet Oscar Wilde. You woke up this morning feeling optimistic. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "National Youth Orchestra/Elder review – monumental Strauss sees young musicians scale the heights ‘Ascent” is the title for the National Youth Orchestra’s current tour, and the dominant theme is mountaineering, at once taken literally and as a metaphor for artistic aspiration and striving. Strauss’s Alpine Symphony, pitting man against the impersonal magnificence of nature, is the main work, to which the evening’s curtain raiser, a new piece by Dani Howard, also called Ascent, forms a". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
